intro: Apatostelis rufobrunnea, commonly known as the red-brown apatostelis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruit is a dry, two-valved schizocarp. This species is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
